zone.line: I slept too undisturbed by dreams, and
awoke refreshed to again enjoy my
tranquil freedom.
In four days we arrived at
the harbour to which we were
bound. I would not remain on the sea
cosl coast, but proceeded immediately
inland. I had already planned the
situation where I would live. It
should be a solitary house on a
wide plain near no other habita
tion: where I could behold the whole
horizon, and wander far without
molestation from the sight of my fel-
low creatures. I was not y mysanthropic,
but I felt that the gentle current
of my feelings depended upon my being
alone. I fixed myself on a wide
solitude. On a dreary heath bestrewen
with stones, among which short grass
grew, and here and there a few rushes
beside a little pool. Not far from
my cottage was a small cluster of
